verses.verse: And the men <S%H376><s%> of Ephraim <S%H669><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H4100><s%>, Why hast thou served <S%H6213><s%> us thus <S%H1697><s%>, that thou calledst <S%H7121><s%> us not <S%H1980><s%>, when thou wentest to fight <S%H3898><s%> with Midian <S%H4080><s%>? And they did chide <S%H7378><s%> with him sharply <S%H2394><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H6213><s%>, What have I now done in comparison with you <S%H5955><s%>? Is not the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim <S%H669><s%> better <S%H2896><s%> than the vintage <S%H1210><s%> of Abiezer <S%H44><s%>?

God <S%H430><s%> hath delivered <S%H5414><s%> into your hand <S%H3027><s%> the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%>, Oreb <S%H6159><s%> and Zeeb <S%H2062><s%>: and what was I able <S%H3201><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> in comparison with you <S%H7307><s%>? Then their anger was abated <S%H7503><s%> toward him <S%H1697><s%>, when he had said that <S%H1696><s%>.

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to the Jordan <S%H3383><s%>, and passed over <S%H5674><s%>, he <S%H7969><s%>, and the three hundred <S%H3967><s%> men <S%H376><s%> that were with him <S%H5889><s%>, faint, yet pursuing <S%H7291><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto the men <S%H582><s%> of Succoth <S%H5523><s%>, Give <S%H5414><s%>, I pray you <S%H3603><s%>, loaves of bread <S%H3899><s%> unto the people <S%H5971><s%> that follow <S%H7272><s%> me <S%H5889><s%>; for they are faint, and I am pursuing <S%H7291><s%> after <S%H310><s%> Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%>, the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%>.

And the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Succoth <S%H5523><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Are the hands <S%H3709><s%> of Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> now in thy hand <S%H3027><s%>, that we should give <S%H5414><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> unto thine army <S%H6635><s%>?

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Therefore when Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> hath delivered <S%H5414><s%> Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> into my hand <S%H3027><s%>, then I will tear <S%H1758><s%> your flesh <S%H1320><s%> with the thorns <S%H6975><s%> of the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> and with briers <S%H1303><s%>.

And he went up <S%H5927><s%> thence to Penuel <S%H6439><s%>, and spake <S%H1696><s%> unto them in like <S%H2063><s%> manner <S%H582><s%>; and the men of Penuel <S%H6439><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> him as the men <S%H582><s%> of Succoth <S%H5523><s%> had answered <S%H6030><s%>.

And he spake <S%H559><s%> also unto the men <S%H582><s%> of Penuel <S%H6439><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, When I come again <S%H7725><s%> in peace <S%H7965><s%>, I will break down <S%H5422><s%> this tower <S%H4026><s%>.

Now Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> were in Karkor <S%H7174><s%>, and their hosts <S%H4264><s%> with them <S%H2568><s%>, about fifteen thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H3498><s%>, all that were left of all the host <S%H4264><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of the east <S%H6924><s%>; for there fell <S%H5307><s%> a hundred <S%H3967><s%> and twenty <S%H6242><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%> that drew <S%H8025><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%>.

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%> of them that dwelt <S%H7931><s%> in tents <S%H168><s%> on the east <S%H6924><s%> of Nobah <S%H5025><s%> and Jogbehah <S%H3011><s%>, and smote <S%H5221><s%> the host <S%H4264><s%>; for the host <S%H4264><s%> was secure <S%H983><s%>.

And Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> fled <S%H5127><s%>; and he pursued <S%H7291><s%> after <S%H310><s%> them <S%H3920><s%>; and he took the two <S%H8147><s%> kings <S%H4428><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%>, Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%>, and discomfited <S%H2729><s%> all the host <S%H4264><s%>.
And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Joash <S%H3101><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> from the battle <S%H4421><s%> from <S%H4608><s%> the ascent of Heres <S%H2775><s%>.

And he caught <S%H3920><s%> a young man <S%H5288><s%> of the men <S%H5288><s%> of Succoth <S%H5523><s%>, and inquired <S%H7592><s%> of him <S%H3789><s%>: and he described for him the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Succoth <S%H5523><s%>, and the elders <S%H2205><s%> thereof <S%H7657><s%>, seventy and seven men <S%H376><s%>.

And he came <S%H935><s%> unto the men <S%H582><s%> of Succoth <S%H5523><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Behold Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%>, concerning whom ye did taunt <S%H2778><s%> me <S%H559><s%>, saying, Are the hands <S%H3709><s%> of Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> now in thy hand <S%H3027><s%>, that we should give <S%H5414><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> unto thy men <S%H582><s%> that are weary <S%H3287><s%>?

And he took <S%H3947><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%>, and thorns <S%H6975><s%> of the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> and briers <S%H1303><s%>, and with them he taught <S%H3045><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> of Succoth <S%H5523><s%>.
And he brake down <S%H5422><s%> the tower <S%H4026><s%> of Penuel <S%H6439><s%>, and slew <S%H2026><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> he unto Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%>, What <S%H375><s%> manner of men <S%H582><s%> were they whom ye slew <S%H2026><s%> at Tabor <S%H8396><s%>? And they answered <S%H559><s%>, As thou <S%H3644><s%> art <S%H259><s%>, so were they; each one resembled <S%H8389><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of a king <S%H4428><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, They were my brethren <S%H251><s%>, the sons <S%H1121><s%> of my mother <S%H517><s%>: as Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> liveth <S%H2416><s%>, if <S%H3863><s%> ye had saved them alive <S%H2421><s%>, I would not slay you <S%H2026><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto Jether <S%H3500><s%> his first-born <S%H1060><s%>, Up <S%H6965><s%>, and slay <S%H2026><s%> them <S%H5288><s%>. But the youth drew <S%H8025><s%> not his sword <S%H2719><s%>; for he feared <S%H3372><s%>, because he was yet a youth <S%H5288><s%>.

Then Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Rise <S%H6965><s%> thou <S%H6293><s%>, and fall upon us <S%H376><s%>; for as the man is <S%H1369><s%>, so is his strength. And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%>, and slew <S%H2026><s%> Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%>, and took <S%H3947><s%> the crescents <S%H7720><s%> that were on their camels <S%H1581><s%>' necks <S%H6677><s%>.

Then the men <S%H376><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Gideon <S%H1439><s%>, Rule <S%H4910><s%> thou over us <S%H1121><s%>, both thou, and thy son, and thy son <S%H1121><s%>'s son <S%H1121><s%> also <S%H3467><s%>; for thou hast saved us out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%>.

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H4910><s%>, I will not rule over you <S%H1121><s%>, neither shall my son rule <S%H4910><s%> over you <S%H3068><s%>: Jehovah shall rule over you <S%H4910><s%>.

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H7592><s%>, I would make a request <S%H7596><s%> of you <S%H5414><s%>, that ye would give me every man <S%H376><s%> the ear-rings <S%H5141><s%> of his spoil <S%H7998><s%>. (For they had golden <S%H2091><s%> ear-rings <S%H5141><s%>, because they were Ishmaelites <S%H3459><s%>.)

And they answered <S%H559><s%>, We will willingly <S%H5414><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> them <S%H6566><s%>. And they spread a garment <S%H8071><s%>, and did cast <S%H7993><s%> therein every man <S%H376><s%> the ear-rings <S%H5141><s%> of his spoil <S%H7998><s%>.

And the weight <S%H4948><s%> of the golden <S%H2091><s%> ear-rings <S%H5141><s%> that he requested <S%H7592><s%> was a thousand <S%H505><s%> and seven <S%H7651><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels of gold <S%H2091><s%>, besides the crescents <S%H7720><s%>, and the pendants <S%H5188><s%>, and the purple <S%H713><s%> raiment <S%H899><s%> that was on the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%>, and besides the chains <S%H6060><s%> that were about their camels <S%H1581><s%>' necks <S%H6677><s%>.

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> an ephod <S%H646><s%> thereof <S%H3322><s%>, and put it in his city <S%H5892><s%>, even in Ophrah <S%H6084><s%>: and all Israel <S%H3478><s%> played the harlot <S%H2181><s%> after <S%H310><s%> it there <S%H4170><s%>; and it became a snare unto Gideon <S%H1439><s%>, and to his house <S%H1004><s%>.

So Midian <S%H4080><s%> was subdued <S%H3665><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and they lifted up <S%H5375><s%> their heads <S%H7218><s%> no more <S%H3254><s%>. And the land <S%H776><s%> had rest <S%H8252><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of Gideon <S%H1439><s%>.
And Jerubbaal <S%H3378><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Joash <S%H3101><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> and dwelt <S%H3427><s%> in his own house <S%H1004><s%>.
And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> had threescore and ten <S%H7657><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> of his body <S%H3409><s%> begotten <S%H3318><s%>; for he had many <S%H7227><s%> wives <S%H802><s%>.
And his concubine <S%H6370><s%> that was in Shechem <S%H7927><s%>, she also bare <S%H3205><s%> him a son <S%H1121><s%>, and he called <S%H7760><s%> his name <S%H8034><s%> Abimelech <S%H40><s%>.

And Gideon <S%H1439><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Joash <S%H3101><s%> died <S%H4191><s%> in a good <S%H2896><s%> old age <S%H7872><s%>, and was buried <S%H6912><s%> in the sepulchre <S%H6913><s%> of Joash <S%H3101><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>, in Ophrah <S%H6084><s%> of the Abiezrites <S%H33><s%>.

And it came to pass <S%H1439><s%>, as soon as Gideon was dead <S%H4191><s%>, that the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> turned again <S%H7725><s%>, and played the harlot <S%H2181><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the Baalim <S%H1168><s%>, and made <S%H7760><s%> Baal-berith <S%H1170><s%> their god <S%H430><s%>.

And the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> not Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> their God <S%H430><s%>, who had delivered <S%H5337><s%> them out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of all their enemies <S%H341><s%> on every side <S%H5439><s%>;

neither showed <S%H6213><s%> they kindness <S%H2617><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of Jerubbaal <S%H3378><s%>, who is Gideon <S%H1439><s%>, according to all the goodness <S%H2896><s%> which he had showed <S%H6213><s%> unto Israel <S%H3478><s%>.
